title: Meg Wolitzer on "The Female Persuasion"
description: Wolitzer's new novel is about women, misogyny, ambition, death, and the disillusionment of growing older.  It's on virtually every must-read list this year, and feels so perfectly forged for the current moment that the Washington Post called Meg 'the novelist we need right now.' Email the show at samsanders@npr.org and tweet @NPRItsBeenAMin with feels.
